snippet: The National Archives unearths thousands of photographs commissioned by the fledgling Environmental Protection Agency in the 1970's, when the country was shifting from the untrammeled exploitation of natural resources to a more aspirational attitude.
abstract: The National Archives unearths thousands of photographs commissioned by the fledgling Environmental Protection Agency in the 1970's, when the country was shifting from the untrammeled exploitation of natural resources to a more aspirational attitude.

headline.main: A Photographic Blast From the Past
